intro: Aquilicia crispa, commonly known as the brittleweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its succulent, often hairy stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant is adapted to arid environments, with thick leaves that help reduce water loss. Its flowers are typically greenish-white or yellowish, and it produces small, dry fruits. Aquilicia crispa is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is used in traditional medicine by local communities.
